tooltip.item.magitech.polished_redstone_: Not just a command. A command you can't ignore.

tooltip.item.magitech.radiant_steel_ingo: The radiance that seized the world.

tooltip.item.magitech.polished_abyssite: The void fills everything—even the inside of objects.

tooltip.item.magitech.sulfuric_acid_batt: Unleash a torrent of subatomic fury.

tooltip.item.magitech.boots_frame: Iron skeletal boots that gather intangible alchemy.
tooltip.item.magitech.mana_berries: A crystalline berries brimming with mana.
tooltip.item.magitech.mana_pie: A true crystal cake that glows!
tooltip.item.magitech.alchemical_flask: One of many ways to resist volatility.
tooltip.item.magitech.lava_flask: For those prepared to burn with their creation.
tooltip.item.magitech.sulfuric_acid_flas: Protective gear? Such a thing does not exist.
tooltip.item.magitech.mana_potion_flask: An impure, modest lump of drinkable mana.
tooltip.item.magitech.healing_potion_fla: What does it mean to violate medical taboos?
tooltip.item.magitech.glace_potion_flask: Sharpen the mind, slow the body.
tooltip.item.magitech.surge_potion_flask: A liquid of ignorance that cleaves the branches.
tooltip.item.magitech.tremor_potion_flas: A pocket-sized tremor touched by the abyss.
tooltip.item.magitech.magic_potion_flask: The ultimate aspiration of any arcane engineer.
tooltip.item.magitech.flow_potion_flask: Flow outward, taking the shape of all around you.

tooltip.block.magitech.deepslate_tourmal: A work of art painted in the dye of energy.
tooltip.block.magitech.fluorite_crystal_: Mana glows like fireflies, welcoming a heated embrace.
tooltip.block.magitech.redstone_crystal_: Just because it's powder doesn't mean it can't be crystal.

Is it stone, a gem, or perhaps metal?
Caution: May fracture under mana conduction!
Ideal pillar material for refining devices.
tooltip.block.magitech.alchecrysite_bric: All for the sake of streamlined energy.
tooltip.block.magitech.alchecrysite_tile: The blue-gray paths carry written meaning.

tooltip.block.magitech.fluorite_brick_wa: An absolute barrier empowered by mana.

tooltip.block.magitech.celifern_button: Probably safe enough for basic alchemy.
tooltip.block.magitech.celifern_sapling: An expert in adapting to its environment.
tooltip.block.magitech.mistalia_petals: They bloom where the light shines brightest.

tooltip.block.magitech.charcoal_birch_tr: A dialogue between obsidian and magma.
tooltip.block.magitech.charcoal_birch_bu: A fingertip proxy of molten stone.

book.magitech.glistening_lexicon.name: Glistening Lexicon
book.magitech.glistening_lexicon.landing: A basic guide to combat in this world, left behind by someone unknown.
book.magitech.the_fire_that_thinks.name: "The Fire That Thinks"
book.magitech.the_fire_that_thinks.landi: An alchemical tome on the fundamentals of the craft. "Chemistry demands flame; alchemy wields thinking mana in its place."
In science, mana is just another form of energy
A Book You Didn't Ask for
The Gear That Drives It All
Assemble a tool using the Assembly Workbench
Assemble a wand using the Assembly Workbench
Enhance a tool using the Tool Upgrade Workbench
Upgrade a tool to Tier 10 using the Tool Upgrade Workbench
Upgrade a tool to Tier 30 using the Tool Upgrade Workbench
toast.magitech.tier_up.title: Mastery Achieved!
key.magitech.open_thread_bound_page_scre: Open Thread Page Screen of Threadbound
book.magitech.glistening_lexicon.introdu:
You’re probably confused to have this suddenly handed to you, but I’ve put together the basic knowledge you’ll need to live in this world. People from other dimensions wander in from time to time, and it seems you’re one of them.   
Start by reading this section and learning how to survive here.   
I’ve also included the fundamentals of alchemy and magic.   
You can reread this book anytime later, so take your time and learn at your own pace.

If you read the pages connected from here in order, you should be able to understand things well enough.   
And if you lose or break this book, you can always get or make another one.   
Things like that are pretty common in this world.

In this world, there’s something far more powerful than swords or bows — magic.   
Not everyone can use it, but it looks like you have talent, so I’ve given you this book you’ll need.   
If you don’t have a wand yet, check the tools section and craft one first.

To use magic, you need this Threadbound you’re reading now, a wand, and the Thread Pages inside the Threadbound.   
The Threadbound is the book used to cast magic, the wand is the tool that releases it, and the Thread Page is like the blueprint of the spell.   
Make sure you understand the role of each one.

Hold this book and press [N] to view the Thread Page. It determines what kind of magic the spell becomes, and each Thread Page contains one attribute and one spell type.   
The attribute determines what the magic uses — for example, Scorching uses fire, Freezing uses cold, and so on.   
The spell type determines how the magic is fired — projectiles shoot bullets, beams release rays of energy.   
The combination of attribute and spell type determines the spell you get.

Thread Pages can be found while traveling or crafted, and if there’s a shop, you might even be able to buy them.   
From what I know, engineers sometimes gather in small huts with white roofs, and they usually have supplies related to magic. It might be worth checking them out.

This book you’re reading contains the wiring needed to use magic. Books like these, which allow you to cast magic, are called Threadbounds, and they come in various forms.   
Most of them come with explanations like this, so try crafting one when you have the time.
Press [,] to open the manual, and [N] to open the Thread Page slot. You can’t fit too many Thread Pages inside, so choose carefully.

This blue-green gemstone has the ability to store mana, allowing it to charge and hold mana or supply mana to tools that require it.   
Fluorite can be mined as an ore, and tools made from processed fluorite can store mana, making them very handy for magic use.

Mana is the energy that fills this world, and you need it to cast magic. Think of it as the fuel for magic — using magic consumes it.   
Mana naturally regenerates over time, but items like Mana Berries can speed up recovery.   
If your mana reaches zero, you won’t be able to cast spells, so be careful.

Strands are thread-like channels that guide mana when you use magic.   
Strands regenerate slowly, and repeatedly casting the same spell will drain them, weakening the spell.   
There are three types of Strands: Noctis, Luminis, and Fluxia.

Once you craft a wand following the tools section, you’re ready to cast magic.   
Hold the wand and follow the steps on the right to cast a spell.   
If it still doesn’t work, go back and reread the previous section.

1. Place the Threadbound into your Curios inventory   
2. Press [N] to insert a Thread Page into the Threadbound   
3. Hold a wand in one hand   
4. Select a spell with [R], then right-click to cast

You can use magic on items to process them into other items.      
Here, I'll explain how to charge mana into fluorite. This method may work for various items, not just fluorite.

First, drop the fluorite on the ground. Then, cast Enercrux at the fluorite to convert it. The trick is to aim at the ground near the fluorite, not its center.      
When you pick up the fluorite, it should be charged with mana.

If it sparkles like this, that's proof it's charged.      
To use it, break the fluorite and extract the mana inside. This will instantly restore your mana.

If you want to learn more complex and powerful magic, make this book.      
This book contains most of the magic currently developed, and if you obtain it, you can use them too.      
Just having it is useful.

It also contains detailed technical specifications, so you can think about magic combinations.      
As a Threadbound, it's highly functional, so it's worth having.

Tools are always your allies. The wand is especially important.      
So here I'll explain how to make tools simply.      
To make a tool, you first need parts, and you can make parts from any material you like. There are strong combinations, so research well.      
The material and the part determine the tool's characteristics.

To prepare for making tools, you need to prepare parts first.      
Parts can be made from wood, stone, iron, etc., and you combine several parts to make a tool.      
Most tools need a handle and a blade.

Materials are too hard to shape by hand, so use the engineering workbench to cut materials into parts.      
If you put materials (like stripped logs or stone blocks) in, you can process them into parts.      
Sometimes you need several materials to make one part, so prepare plenty.

It's better to decide what tool and materials you want to make before making parts.      
There are almost infinite combinations, like copper and gold, or bone and stone.

Once you have the parts, just use the engineering assembly table to assemble the tool.      
Check if you got the tool you wanted.

There are many types of tools, each with its own features.      
Which one you make is up to you, but making a wand first is best.      
Also, make some combat weapons.
Short reach but can be swung quickly. Great for stress relief.
The most recommended and easy-to-use weapon. Make this first.
The miner's best friend, used most often.
Leave area attacks to this tool.
A simple and easy-to-use beginner's wand. Definitely make this. Most books use this wand.

For more details on tool making, check the new book here.      
It covers more efficient methods, material features, and tool design.      
This book will help you when making tools.
It can also be used as a Threadbound, so it's worth making. Apparently, you can use a lot of magic quickly.

Alchemy is a craft that uses mana and similar energies to change the properties of matter or to combine substances.   
It is a form of chemistry using mana and forms the foundation for tools that use magic.   
This section provides a brief introduction to alchemy.

This colorless gem can contain various energies and is used in alchemy as a vessel for alchemical aspects.   
It can be fairly easily mined underground, so look for more if you run short.   
It does not form visible crystals on the surface like fluorite, so you need to inspect carefully.

Zardius alchemy is a type of alchemy where you put liquids, materials, and mana into a large cauldron and heat them to trigger a chemical reaction—the simplest form of alchemy.   
A Zardius alchemy cauldron is required.

A cauldron made from tourmaline used for Zardius alchemy; to perform it you need this plus a heat source such as lava or a campfire beneath it.   
Put the required amount of liquid and the exact quantity of materials into the cauldron and wait for the process to finish.

There are eight alchemical aspects; here only the method for extracting the magic aspect needed for the next alchemy book is described.   
Use alchemy to convert mana into an alchemical aspect, then seal it into tourmaline.

Amethyst contains a large amount of the magic aspect and its properties are used to convert mana. The magic aspect is an energy related to the concepts of technology and magic and is required in many alchemical processes.

A special concrete-like material used in alchemy, made by mixing gems and various rocks.   
Alchecrysite is used as a material for alchemical devices, so it is good to make several pieces ahead of time.

It has properties that stabilize mana energy and is used in large amounts, but it is expensive because it uses gold.   
Moreover, it requires several processing steps, making mass production difficult.

More advanced alchemy is not covered here, so a separate book will need to be made.   
That book is a specialist alchemy tome and can also be used as a Threadbound.   
Read that book to advance to the next stage of alchemy.

To be honest, all the alchemy described here exists to produce that book.   
It contains more convenient alchemical techniques and principles—please create it.   
As a Threadbound it becomes a heavy, single-strike type of magic.
book.magitech.the_fire_that_thinks.alche: Alchemy
Alchemy
Alchemy

In short, alchemy is chemistry that uses mana and alchemical aspects.   
Operations that change the composition and structure of matter by using properties unique to mana and alchemical aspects are called alchemy.   
This book explains the basic principles of alchemy and their applications.

First, alchemy does not stand alone. Preparation of materials, construction of devices, and an understanding of how energy acts are necessary.   
Only when these elements are combined does alchemy demonstrate its true value and become useful.
Zardius Alchemy
Zardius Alchemy

Zardius alchemy is the most basic alchemical method that uses liquids and materials to trigger reactions.   
Materials and liquids are placed in a specialized cauldron and mana is added to induce special chemical reactions.   
This simple method has many applications and is widely used as the foundation of alchemy.

A dedicated cauldron must be prepared for Zardius alchemy. This cauldron is made of tourmaline and can be heated by placing a heat source underneath.   
This cauldron is called a Zardius alchemy cauldron; by placing liquids and materials inside, the desired reaction can be induced.
Alchemical Aspect
Alchemical Aspects

Alchemical aspects are energies with effects different from mana.   
There are eight aspects, each with distinct properties, uses, and concepts.   
Unlike mana, they are unstable and readily change into other energies; each aspect tends to convert into specific types of energy.
Ember Aspect
Symbolizes flame and heat. Converts to thermal energy.
Glace Aspect
Symbolizes crystal and cold. Converts to temperature differences.
Surge Aspect
Symbolizes high energy and current. Converts to electrical energy.
Phantom Aspect
Symbolizes light and translucency. Converts to light energy.
Tremor Aspect
Symbolizes vibration and sound waves. Converts to disordered motion.
Magic Aspect
Symbolizes alchemy and summoning. Converts to magical creatures and chemical energy.
Flow Aspect
Symbolizes life and fluids. Converts to regular motion.
Hollow Aspect
Symbolizes space and the void. Converts to abnormal movement of objects, disappearance phenomena, and spatial distortions.

Using these properties, most magical energies employ alchemical aspects.   
Magic that uses mana releases mana energy and has limited impact, whereas alchemical aspects convert immediately into other energies, making them more efficient as weapons.
Aspect Crystal
Aspect Crystal

Alchemical aspects are unstable on their own and unsuitable for long-term storage.   
By sealing them in crystals they can be stabilized, making storage and transport easier.   
Tourmaline and quartz are mainly used for such crystals.

When an aspect is sealed in a crystal, the crystal's properties change according to the aspect and it cannot be reused. Also, if the crystal is destroyed the internal aspect may be released suddenly and cause explosions, so handle with care.   
Next, the method to create aspect crystals is shown.
A heated crystal. Can be extracted from fuel.
A crystal that grows from its surroundings. Can be extracted from crystals.
A flashing crystal. Can be extracted from metal.
A phasing crystal. Can be extracted from semi-actual substances.
A trembling crystal. Can be extracted from rock.
A power-emitting crystal. Can be extracted from mana-infused materials.
A wind-wreathed crystal. Can be extracted from living things.
A crystal that distorts time and space. Can be extracted from the Void.
Alchecrysite
Alchecrysite

Alchecrysite is a primary material for alchemical devices, made by reacting fluorite, calcite, and various other minerals.   
It stabilizes mana energy and is widely used to improve the efficiency and stability of alchemical apparatus.

In this alchemy, reactions use aspects rather than mana.   
Using aspects draws out more characteristic effects and enables a variety of reactions.
Mana Potion
Mana Potion

Mana potions are basic alchemical products used as raw materials for various substances.   
They are extracted from materials containing high concentrations of mana and are used as an inexpensive substitute for fluorite.   
When consumed, they temporarily restore mana.
A basic ingredient for liquid alchemy.
Alchemical Flask
Alchemical Flask

High-energy liquids like mana potions cannot be stably stored in ordinary glass containers.   
Alchemical flasks are special containers made from mana-shielding glass that can safely store and transport high-energy liquids.
A substance stable as a reagent that preserves energy differences between inside and outside.
A bottle commonly used in alchemy.
Aspect Potion
Aspect Potion

Aspect potions are the alchemical-aspect version of mana potions—liquids with an aspect sealed inside.   
They can be made in a Zardius alchemy cauldron by adding the appropriate aspect crystal to the liquid and materials.   
When consumed, they grant temporary effects of the aspect.
A burning-hot liquid.
A cold liquid that emits white vapor.
A liquid that frequently discharges internally.
A liquid that emits and refracts light.
A viscous, heavy liquid.
A luminous, mysterious liquid.
A continuously flowing liquid.
A liquid that contains abnormal space.
Healing Potion
Healing Potion

Healing potions are alchemically produced liquids with restorative effects.   
They are not used as raw materials but are widely used in medical fields.   
When consumed, they restore health and heal minor wounds.
May cause abnormal growth.
Sulfuric Acid
Sulfuric Acid

Sulfuric acid is a commonly corrosive liquid produced by alchemy.   
It has strong acidity and can dissolve many substances, making it widely used for alchemical reactions and material pre-processing.   
Handle with care and use appropriate protective equipment.
The discovery of an alchemical production method has greatly reduced its cost.
Sulfuric Acid Battery
Sulfuric Acid Battery

A sulfuric acid battery is a device that converts material change into electrical energy.   
It uses the strong corrosiveness of sulfuric acid to trigger chemical reactions and extract electrical energy from those reactions.   
This battery supplies weak power to alchemical devices and tools.   
However, sustained output or long-term storage should not be expected.
A substitute for continuous weak surge-aspect crystals.
Mana Device
Mana Device

In alchemy, a mana device is required to supply mana in an appropriate form. Fluorite has the property of storing mana and is commonly used in mana devices. Mana has properties similar to electric current, but it does not need to be configured in a loop circuit and can function with a single line.

Unlike electric current, mana has a concept of concentration. In mana devices, energy is supplied by letting mana charged in fluorite flow from high concentration to low concentration. Therefore, if the ambient mana concentration is high, it may not function correctly.

A container for long-term storage of mana. Mana does not leak except through the gold terminals connected at the top and bottom. To charge mana, use an item filled with mana on the device or apply high-concentration mana, such as an Enercrux.
A terminal that sends mana as a spark to a distant location.
A component that absorbs mana from mana-bearing particles and re-stabilizes it. Used for advanced processing.
A part that collects alchemical phases present in the environment. Essential for tools and devices that utilize alchemical phases.
Athanor
Athanor

More complex devices require precise material processing. The athanor is a large alchemical device made from alchemic crystal that generates mana sparks to cause precise adhesion and synthesis of materials.
It uses properties that accelerate Seriphane reactions to help mana sparks adhere materials to substrates. Used by placing material on the top as a pedestal.
Incorporates a mana de-excitation core to stabilize material particles produced by mana sparks on the surface of substrates. Used by placing the substrate on the top as a pedestal.
Athanor Altar
A large processing alchemical device that uses large amounts of mana.
Alchemical Equipment
Alchemical Equipment
By applying alchemical phases and the properties of mana, various equipment can be made. These items possess special effects.

The semi-physical nature of phantoms can be used to prevent physical interference. Alone they cannot fully demonstrate this property, so alchemy fills them with mana and uses them as Alke fabric. For small amounts, apply an Enercrux to the phantom's membrane to convert it.
Mana and alchemical phase energies affect the wearer, so a fabric that blocks them is required. Combining obsidian, mana-imbued membranes, and other minerals can achieve strong energy resistance.
Spatial Aether Lifter
Spatial Aether Lifter

Equipment that enables vertical acceleration in the air by combining the Annihilation phase and the Illusion phase. Controlling the annihilation phase with the illusion phase achieves effective levitation, but due to high energy consumption it cannot be used repeatedly many times.
Flamglide Strider
Flamglide Strider

Equipment that enables high-speed movement by utilizing the explosive reaction of the Scorch phase. Controlled by the Flow phase, it can glide along the ground, but it cannot be reused for a while after use.
book.magitech.materials_and_toolcraft_de: Toolcraft is a design method to understand material properties and make the most of them. Proper material selection and design can improve tool performance, durability, and special effects. This book explains the principles of toolcraft, various material properties, and how to combine them.

Rather than selecting materials arbitrarily, designing to exploit their inherent properties produces better tools. For example, using a hard material for the blade improves sharpness, and using a lightweight material for the handle improves handling. Understanding and properly combining these properties is the key to toolcraft.
Tools come in many shapes and uses. For example: axes, pickaxes, shovels, swords, staves, etc., each with different functions and properties. Here we list each tool, its stats, and uses.

Performance is determined by the tool's shape and material properties. Specifically: (Base Performance) = (Tool's inherent multiplier) * (Average of each material's (material stat) * (part multiplier)).
Here, normal tools refer to weapons for combat and basic tools for mining, logging, farming, etc. These depend mainly on physical performance; material hardness, durability, and weight are important.

In this case, tool performance is determined by the following elements: - Attack Damage: Physical damage dealt in combat. - Elemental Attack Damage: Additional damage from material's alchemical phases. - Attack Speed: Frequency of attacks. - Mining Speed: Speed of gathering objects in the environment.
- Defense: Ability to reduce incoming damage. - Attack Range: Maximum distance an attack can reach. - Sweep Range: Area that can be hit at once. - Durability: Number of uses before breaking.
A short blade specialized for close-range single-target combat. Short reach but can be swung quickly, enabling fast attacks. Lightweight and easy to handle, but vulnerable to counterattacks.
Inherent multipliers - Attack Damage: 2.0 - Elemental Attack Damage: 3.0 - Attack Speed: 3.0 - Mining Speed: 5.0 - Defense: 2.0 - Attack Range: 2.5 - Sweep Range: 1.0 - Durability: 288
Part multipliers - Handguard: 1.1 - Light Blade: 1.5 - Light Handle: 0.4
A versatile offensive tool. Lightweight and easy to handle, optimized for melee combat. Balanced attack power and speed, used by beginners and experts alike.
Inherent multipliers - Attack Damage: 4.0 - Elemental Attack Damage: 4.0 - Attack Speed: 1.6 - Mining Speed: 5.0 - Defense: 2.0 - Attack Range: 3.0 - Sweep Range: 3.0 - Durability: 361
Part multipliers - Tool Binding: 0.3 - Handguard: 1.3 - Light Blade: 1.5 - Light Handle: 0.9
A heavyweight offensive tool. High attack power; its massive blade can also act as a shield. Requires skill to handle, but its power and defense surpass other tools.
Inherent multipliers - Attack Damage: 6.0 - Elemental Attack Damage: 4.0 - Attack Speed: 0.8 - Mining Speed: 5.0 - Defense: 6.0 - Attack Range: 3.0 - Sweep Range: 3.0 - Durability: 536
Part multipliers - Tool Binding: 0.3 - Handguard: 1.1 - Heavy Blade: 1.7 - Light Handle: 0.9
A tool specialized for mining stone and ores. Designed to efficiently break high-hardness materials. Low durability but versatile for mining.
Inherent multipliers - Attack Damage: 2.0 - Elemental Attack Damage: 1.0 - Attack Speed: 2.4 - Mining Speed: 5.0 - Defense: 1.0 - Attack Range: 2.5 - Sweep Range: 1.5 - Durability: 319
Part multipliers - Tool Binding: 0.5 - Spike Head: 1.7 - Heavy Handle: 0.8
A tool specialized for large-scale excavation. Has heavy striking power and can destroy wide areas at once. High durability for long-term use.
Inherent multipliers - Attack Damage: 8.0 - Elemental Attack Damage: 7.0 - Attack Speed: 0.6 - Mining Speed: 3.0 - Defense: 4.0 - Attack Range: 2.5 - Sweep Range: 2.0 - Durability: 1013
Part multipliers - Tool Binding: 0.3 - Plate: 1.2 - Strike Head: 1.7 - Heavy Handle: 0.8
A tool specialized for cutting wood. Has a sharp blade and some weight to efficiently fell trees. Slightly shorter reach than swords, but balanced for combat use.
Inherent multipliers - Attack Damage: 5.0 - Elemental Attack Damage: 3.0 - Attack Speed: 1.0 - Mining Speed: 5.0 - Defense: 5.0 - Attack Range: 3.5 - Sweep Range: 3.0 - Durability: 325
Part multipliers - Tool Binding: 0.2 - Strike Head: 1.3 - Light Blade: 1.9 - Heavy Handle: 0.6
A tool specialized for digging soil and gravel. Has a wide blade and a wide handle to apply force, allowing quick digging. The plate part can be used for defense.
Inherent multipliers - Attack Damage: 3.0 - Elemental Attack Damage: 3.0 - Attack Speed: 2.0 - Mining Speed: 5.0 - Defense: 6.0 - Attack Range: 3.0 - Sweep Range: 4.0 - Durability: 401
Part multipliers - Tool Binding: 0.5 - Plate: 1.2 - Light Blade: 1.7 - Heavy Handle: 0.6

A tool specialized for wide-range attacks and harvesting. The long shaft and curved blade allow attacking wide areas at once. Suitable for fragile materials that do not become obstacles, such as harvesting crops.
Inherent multipliers - Attack Damage: 3.0 - Elemental Attack Damage: 6.0 - Attack Speed: 0.7 - Mining Speed: 5.0 - Defense: 2.0 - Attack Range: 4.5 - Sweep Range: 6.0 - Durability: 378
Part multipliers - Tool Binding: 0.2 - Heavy Handle: 1.9 - Heavy Blade: 0.8 - Reinforced Stick: 1.1

Arcane tools here refer to implements that use mana and alchemical-phase energy to produce special effects. These tools mainly depend on energy properties — a material's mana conductivity, energy storage capacity, and discharge efficiency are important factors. Stat values are calculated on a zero-based scale after subtracting the inherent multiplier.

In this case, a tool's performance is determined by the following elements:   
- Spell Power: The magnitude of damage dealt by magical attacks.   
- Elemental Spell Power: Additional damage dealt by magic attacks of a matching element.   
- Casting Speed: The rate at which the tool charges until it can fire.   
- Cooldown Speed: The time until the magic circuit can be used again after firing.

- Defense: Ability to reduce incoming damage.   
- Projectile Speed: The initial velocity of magic projectiles.   
- Mana Efficiency: Mana consumption efficiency when using magic.   
- Durability: The number of uses the item can withstand before breaking.
A well-balanced, general-purpose magical device. Lightweight and easy to handle, it delivers consistent power at all ranges and features controllable output characteristics and charge speed.

Base multipliers   
- Spell Power: 1.0   
- Elemental Spell Power: 1.0   
- Casting Speed: 1.0   
- Cooldown Speed: 1.0   
- Defense: 1.0   
- Projectile Speed: 1.0   
- Mana Efficiency: 1.0   
- Durability: 378

Part modifiers   
- Tool Binding: 0.6   
- Conductor: 1.3   
- Light Handle: 0.5   
- Catalyst: 1.6

Tools gain proficiency through use, and once a certain threshold is reached they can be upgraded. Upgrading improves a tool's base performance and enables more powerful effects. Specific materials and a tool upgrade station are required for upgrades.

Each time proficiency reaches its maximum, the Tier increases by 1 and the next maximum proficiency increases. The higher the original material's Tier, the more proficiency is required to reach maximum. There are also upgrades corresponding to each stat.

Items that are not directly related to tool design but exist to store various tools. They improve portability and storage capacity and make tool management easier. This section describes common equipment.
A tool belt worn at the waist allows quick access to multiple tools. Hold [L-Alt] while using it to swap items between the equipped tool belt and held tools.
A tool hanger is a placeable storage unit used to organize and store tools. After placing it, right-click the location where you want to store/retrieve to store or retrieve tools.

Material selection is very important in tool design. Material properties directly affect tool performance, so proper selection is required. This section explains commonly used materials and their properties.
Each material has its own stats and traits; stats affect tool performance, while traits further influence those stats or add special effects.

Trait enhancements are applied multiplicatively to a tool's base stats and have up to three application tiers. (Final Stat) = (Base Stat) * (Total of Tier 1 trait enhancements) * (Total of Tier 2 trait enhancements) * (Total of Tier 3 trait enhancements).

Area-of-effect mining is determined similarly. Therefore, evenly distributing enhancements across all tiers yields high-performance tools. Also, some traits have "Trait Actions," which are optional activatable effects.

The most basic and readily available material. It pairs reasonably well with many materials and can be used in everything from cheap items to valuable tools. Its performance is inferior, so it's best used on parts less affected by fasteners.

Tier: 0   
Trait: Affinity   
Increases all stats by (number of non-wood materials included in the tool * 15%%) (Tier 1 enhancement).
A material excellent for defense and mining. Suitable for scenarios involving heavy stone mining or tool designs prioritizing defense. However, it's not very suitable for other uses.

Tier: 0   
Trait: Geomending   
Can mine stone even without the proper tool, and when mining stone there is a (level * 22%%) chance to recover 1 durability. For magic weapons, defense increases by (level * 80%%) (Tier 1 enhancement).
A very hard stone. Excels at defense and mining hard materials. Tools made from this material can break obsidian in under a second.

Tier: 0   
Trait: Hardened   
When mining, mining speed increases by 20%% of the target block's blast resistance. On attack, there is a (level * 40%%) chance to apply Movement Slowdown II for 5 seconds.
A highly conductive metal. Amplifies elemental damage. Also heavy, so not well-suited for fast attacks.

Tier: 0   
Trait: High Conductivity   
Elemental Attack/Elemental Spell Power increases by (level * 20%%) (Tier 1 enhancement).
A metal that easily generates charge. Has special effects that utilize charge. Low durability.

Tier: 0   
Trait: Static Charge   
On attack/mining, gain a charge for (2 + level * 3) seconds. While charged, Elemental Attack/Elemental Spell Power and Mining Speed/Cooldown Speed increase by (level * 25%%) (Tier 1 enhancement).
An organic material with a sharp cross-section. Relatively lightweight and easy to handle, allowing quick counterattacks. Produces powerful effects when the wielder is attacked.

Tier: 0   
Trait: Fossilization   
When health is below half, Attack/Spell Power and Mining Speed/Cooldown Speed increase by (level * 80%%) (Tier 1 enhancement).
A very fragile and transparent material. If durability is ignored, it offers top-tier performance. Excels at burst damage and is suited for short engagements.

Tier: 0   
Trait: Fragile   
Durability decreases by (100 - 50 / level%%), while other stats increase by (level * 30%%) (Tier 1 enhancement).
A material formed from compacted sand grains. It has low heat capacity, so performance changes with the surrounding environment and it has two distinct natures.

Tier: 0   
Trait: Temperature Difference   
During daytime, Attack/Spell Power and Defense increase by (level * 25%%). At night, Attack Speed/Casting Speed and Mining Speed/Cooldown Speed increase by (level * 25%%) (Tier 1 enhancement).
A soft plant-based material that grows via photosynthesis. It has the ability to slowly repair tools.

Tier: 0   
Trait: Growth   
When the sky is visible, the tool's durability recovers 1 every (30 / level) seconds.

A commonly used metal.   
Well-balanced performance suitable for many uses.   
Noted for durability and ease of work.

Tier: 1   
Trait: Tenacity   
Durability increases by (level * 20%%), and repairing restores an additional (level * 30%%) durability. (Tier 1 enhancement)

A precious, soft metal.   
Highly conductive and suitable for magical tools.   
Low durability but produces powerful effects.

Tier: 1   
Trait: Catalyst   
Adds (level * 25%%) of Elemental Attack/Elemental Spell Power to Attack, Mining Speed/Spell Power, and Projectile Speed; adds half that amount to Mana Efficiency. (Tier 2 enhancement)

A commonly found crystal material.   
Relatively hard and usable for various purposes.   
Has a trait where performance improves as it wears.

Tier: 1   
Trait: Crushing   
Increases attack range/mana efficiency by (percentage of durability consumed * level * 35%%). (Tier 1 enhancement)

A lab-grown crystal material.   
Heat-resistant due to high-temperature processing.   
Pairs very well with Amethyst.

Tier: 1   
Trait: Heat Treatment   
If the tool's materials include Amethyst, Elemental Attack/Elemental Spell Power and Mining Speed/Cooldown Speed increase by (level * 35%%). (Tier 1 enhancement)

An ore that conducts signals.   
Has electrical properties and forcibly accelerates the user.   
Exhibits high maneuverability at the cost of exhaustion.

Tier: 1   
Trait: Red Speed   
If you have hidden saturation, consume saturation to increase Attack Speed/Casting Speedby (level * 30%%) and Mining Speed/Cooldown Speed by (level * 40%%). If there is a redstone signal beneath your feet, the effect applies without consuming saturation and the effect amount is increased by (signal level * 0.8%%). (Tier 3 enhancement)

A valuable blue ore.   
Very fragile and delicate.   
Suitable for collecting and decoration.

Tier: 1   
Trait: Inclusion   
Applies Luck and increased drops equal to the level.

A translucent to white stone mainly found in geodes.   
Has the property of bending light in two directions.   
Suitable for efficient mining and mass attacks.

Tier: 1   
Trait: Birefringence   
When mining, additionally harvest (level) identical blocks at once. (Tier 1 enhancement) On attack, if the target's health is half or less, deal an additional (level) damage.

A pointed stone found in underground caves.   
Soft but capable of large-scale mining.   
Ideal for tree harvesting.

Tier: 1   
Trait: Exsolution   
When mining, if there are four identical blocks vertically, additionally harvest (level * 5) identical blocks at once. (Tier 2 enhancement) When attacking, if you are in water or it is raining at that location, Attack/Spell Power increases by (level * 45%%).

A crystal useful in many situations.   
Has the property of storing mana.   
Very unique performance and can be extremely powerful when conditions are met.

Tier: 1   
Trait: Overcharge   
Non-magic tools: When mana is at maximum, Elemental Attack increases by (level * 25%%) and Mining Speed increases by (level * 35%%).   
Magic tools: When mana is 50%% or more, Spell Power and Casting Speed increase by (level * 35%%). (Tier 1 enhancement)

A crystal that generates voltage when heated.   
Like zinc, it produces charge.   
Provides movement speed increases.

Tier: 1   
Trait: Boost   
On attack/mining, gain a 3-second charge of level (current charge level + 1) (max charge level: level * 2). While charged, movement speed increases by (charge level * 10%%). (Tier 1 enhancement)

The most iconic precious material.   
Extremely hard and highly versatile.   
Suitable for all tools and delivers high performance.

Tier: 2   
Trait: Lightweight   
Attack Speed/Casting Speed and Mining Speed/Cooldown Speed increase by (level * 5%%). (Tier 1 enhancement)

A universally accepted currency.   
Performs very well when used in appropriate contexts.   
Has a trait that is strongest at perfect condition.

Tier: 2   
Trait: Focus   
When health is full and hunger is between 10 and 18, Attack/Spell Power and Mining Speed/Cooldown Speed increase by (level * 50%%). (Tier 1 enhancement)

An alloy containing abundant Ender aspects.   
Strong for relatively long-range attacks.   
Has the trait of attracting distant items.

Tier: 2   
Trait: Ender Draw   
While sneaking, pulls items within (level * 4) blocks.

A colorless crystal.   
Smooth and delicate in nature.   
Can harvest targets without damage.

Tier: 2   
Trait: Smooth   
When the sky is not visible, applies Silk Touch and increases Attack Range/Projectile Speed by (level * 10%%). (Tier 1 enhancement)

A luminous, glassy material.   
Glows without a power source.   
Can be harvested for simple lighting.

Tier: 2   
Trait: Luminescence   
Trait Action: Consume 5 durability to place a light source of light level 15 at the looked-at position.

A synthetic material created by precise chemical calculation.   
Stores energy and releases it in a burst.   
Excels at both attack and mining.

Tier: 2   
Trait: Spark   
On attack/mining, gain a 2-second charge. When mining, if charged, consume all charges to harvest (charge level * 5) identical blocks at once.   
Trait Action: Consume all charges to fire (charge level * 3) 1-damage sparks; on hit they apply 5 seconds of Movement Slowdown V and Mining Speed reduction. When charges are consumed, gain a cooldown of (12 / level) seconds during which charges cannot be gained.

An alloy unearthed from the deep underground.   
Very hard and heavy metal.   
Performs especially well in high-temperature environments.

Tier: 3   
Trait: Lava Furnace   
When at Y ≤ 0 or in the Nether, Attack/Spell Power, Mining Speed, and Casting Speed increase by (level * 60%%). (Tier 1 enhancement)

A high-strength alloy that glows brightly.   
A rare material with an unusual appearance.   
Various effects depend on light.

Tier: 3   
Trait: Radiance   
When light level is 10 or higher, Mining Speed/Cooldown Speed and Attack Range/Mana Efficiency increase by (level * 25%%) (Tier 1 enhancement). When light level is 3 or lower, grants Night Vision.
book.magitech.applied_arcane_circuitry.s:
A typical personal magical weapon consists of a wand, a general-purpose caster, and a thread page that determines its behavior.   
This section focuses on the thread page and explains its behavior.

Thread pages have two types of properties: attribute and shape.   
Attributes indicate the type of alchemical aspect used and grant corresponding damage and effects.   
Shapes describe how the magic is activated and determine the effect's range and targets.   
Enemies that use the same alchemical aspect have resistances.

The projectile type is the most basic shape and fires a magical projectile at a single target.   
In addition to dealing direct damage to the hit target, it can apply additional effects depending on the attribute.   
Projectile speed and power depend on the user's wand performance.

It has a short cooldown but is not suitable for long-range or area attacks.   
Mainly effective against single targets and requires timing considering projectile speed.

The beam type instantly releases high-power energy and is effective against a single target along a line.   
The beam hits upon firing, dealing heavy damage and can apply attribute-based additional effects.   
Beam power and range depend on the user's wand performance.

Requires charging, making it ideal for firing from a safe distance.   
Effective against single targets and requires precise sniping.

The spray type continuously emits energy within a short-range area.   
Variants that add extra effects depending on the attribute are powerful.   
Spray power depends on the user's wand performance.

Excels at area attacks and is suitable for hitting multiple enemies at once.   
Highly effective in close-range combat.

The fragment type releases many small low-power energy chunks and attacks multiple times.   
Each fragment deals damage on hit and can apply attribute-based additional effects.   
Fragment power depends on the user's wand performance.
Effective against both single and multiple targets; suitable for delivering multiple hits in a narrow area.

The field type generates a short-duration energy area that deals continuous damage to targets inside.   
Fields can apply attribute-based additional effects.   
Field power and duration depend on the user's wand performance.
Effective against slow-moving enemies or groups and suitable for tactical positioning.

The explosive type creates an energy explosive that affects a wide area, dealing immediate damage to targets within range.   
Explosions can apply attribute-based additional effects.   
Explosion power and radius depend on the user's wand performance.
Effective against dense groups or enemies with strong defenses; suitable for area attacks.

The charge type requires a relatively long charging time and releases a powerful strike when charged.   
It deals large damage on hit and can apply attribute-based additional effects.   
Charge power depends on the user's wand performance.
Versatile but has a long charge time, so timing of use is important.

The enhancement type temporarily boosts the user's abilities, such as attack, defense, and movement speed.   
Enhancement effects vary by attribute and provide tactical-specific boosts.   
Duration and strength depend on the user's wand performance.
Can greatly improve combat capability when combined with other spells.

The weaken type temporarily reduces a target's abilities such as attack, defense, and movement speed.   
Weaken effects vary by attribute and produce tactical debuffs.   
Duration and strength depend on the user's wand performance.
Can be combined with other spells to gain advantage in combat.

The dash type enables short-distance high-speed movement used to evade attacks or for tactical positioning.   
It may deal attribute-dependent damage or apply additional effects to enemies touched during movement.   
Dash speed or distance depends on the user's wand performance.
Primarily divided into movement and combat uses: movement for long-distance travel and combat for closing in and evasion.

The resilience type grants defensive effects to the user or allies, such as damage reduction and status removal.   
Effects vary by attribute and provide effective defense against specific attacks or environments.   
Duration and strength depend on the user's wand performance.
Has a relatively long cooldown but greatly increases survival in combat. Mainly suited to defensive tactics.

The utility type provides various helpful effects to support the user or allies in combat and exploration.   
Effects vary by attribute and can include things like teleporting to a base.   
Duration and strength depend on the user's wand performance.
Offers tactical flexibility with diverse effects depending on the attribute.

The infuse type alters a target object and is used to obtain materials for certain equipment.   
It can transform the target into another substance.
Not suited for combat and tends to have a short range.

An attribute that uses heat to deal persistent damage.   
Often causes targets to burn and deals high damage.   
Consumes Fraxia and is effective against enemies such as Strays that utilize the Glace or Surge aspects.

An attribute that uses cold to reduce movement speed.   
Often freezes targets and is effective against fast enemies.   
Consumes Noctis and Fraxia and is effective against enemies such as Phantom and Witch that utilize the Phantom or Magic aspects.

An attribute that uses electricity to deliver high instant damage.   
Many attacks consist of rapid multiple strikes and are effective against enemies with healing.   
Consumes Noctis and Luminis and is effective against enemies such as Warden and Phantom that utilize the Tremor or Phantom aspects.

An attribute that uses light to cause restraint and confusion.   
Often has suppressive effects and is effective against powerful enemies.   
Consumes Luminis and is effective against enemies such as Witch and Enderman that utilize the Magic or Hollow aspects.

An attribute that uses vibrations to deliver powerful attacks or cause terrain changes.   
Often features high-power single strikes and is effective against heavily armored enemies.   
Consumes Noctis and is effective against enemies such as Stray and Drowned that utilize the Glace or Flow aspects.

An attribute that uses pure energy to deal steady damage.   
Average performance and effective against common enemies.   
Consumes Fraxia and is effective against enemies such as Drowned that utilize the Flow or Surge aspects.

An attribute that uses flows to cause high-speed forced movement.   
Allows rapid attacks and is effective as a support to other attributes.   
Consumes Luminis and is effective against enemies such as Enderman and Blaze that utilize the Hollow or Ember aspects.

An attribute that uses spacetime distortions to trigger special effects.   
Has diverse effects and is effective against specific enemies.   
Consumes Noctis and is effective against enemies such as Blaze and Warden that utilize the Ember or Tremor aspects.

An attribute that uses pure mana.   
Highly versatile.
Fires an Ember-aspect projectile that extends the target's burning duration by 4 seconds (up to 10 seconds).
After charging, fires a Glace-aspect projectile that extends the target's freeze duration by 10 seconds (up to 15 seconds).
Fires a large Surge-aspect projectile that deals lightning damage to the hit target.
Fires a high-speed Phantom-aspect projectile that grants the hit target 10 seconds of Glowing and 4 seconds of Seize. Seize immobilizes the target.
Fires a Tremor-aspect projectile that searches for and homes in on targets, dealing tremor damage on hit.
Fires a Magic-aspect projectile that deals magic damage to the hit target.
Fires an accelerating Flow-aspect projectile that strongly knocks back the hit target.
Fires a Void-aspect projectile that travels along coordinate axes, ignores obstacles, and deals void damage to the hit target.
Emits an Ember-aspect beam that extends the hit target's burning duration by 5 seconds (up to 10 seconds).
Emits a Glace-aspect beam that extends the hit target's freeze duration by 8 seconds (up to 15 seconds).
After a long charge, emits a Surge-aspect beam that deals lightning damage to the hit target and half that lightning damage to nearby targets.
Emits a Phantom-aspect beam that grants the hit target 5 seconds of Glowing and 2.5 seconds of Seize. Seize immobilizes the target.
Emits a Tremor-aspect beam that deals tremor damage to the hit target.
Emits a Magic-aspect beam that deals magic damage to the hit target.
Emits a Flow-aspect beam that strongly knocks back the hit target.
Emits a fractally splitting Void-aspect beam that applies 4 seconds of Voidrot. Voidrot deals void damage each second (per level) until the target's health is 25%% or less.
Emits an Ember-aspect spray that extends burning duration of targets in the area by 3 seconds (up to 10 seconds).
Emits a Glace-aspect spray that extends freeze duration of targets in the area by 5 seconds (up to 15 seconds).
Emits a Surge-aspect spray that deals lightning damage to targets in the area and nearby targets.
Emits a Phantom-aspect spray that grants targets in the area 5 seconds of Glowing and 0.05 seconds of Seize. Seize immobilizes the target.
Emits a Tremor-aspect spray that applies 2 seconds of Slowness IV and 3 seconds of Darkness to targets in the area.
Emits a Magic-aspect spray that deals magic damage to targets in the area.
Emits a Flow-aspect spray that pulls targets in the area toward the center.
Emits a Void-aspect spray that applies 10 seconds of Weakness II to targets in the area.
Launches an Ember-aspect projectile backward and accelerates. On hit, extends the target's burning duration by 5 seconds (up to 10 seconds). It decelerates when propulsion ends.
Launches a Glace-aspect projectile backward and moves rapidly. After the effect ends, extends freeze duration of targets passed through by 8.5 seconds (up to 15 seconds).
Uses Surge to teleport forward, then summons lightning along the trajectory to deal lightning damage to hit targets.
Uses Phantom to teleport forward and accelerate. Grants the user 2 seconds of Invisibility and 2 seconds of Resistance II.
Uses Tremor to teleport forward. At the destination, destroys blocks mineable by wooden tools in a 5x5 area centered on the teleport point.
Uses Magic to teleport forward and deals magic damage to targets within the area at the destination.
Launches a Flow-aspect projectile backward and accelerates. Does not deal damage.
Uses Void to teleport forward and grants the user 0.25 seconds of Phase Lock. Does not deal damage. Phase Lock holds the target in place.
Envelops the caster with Flow aspect to restore their health.
Releases a Void aspect and teleports the user to their respawn point.
Emits a pure Mana beam that injects mana energy into matter to generate specific materials.
